visual cues body language but also actively listening to their words you
acknowledge what they're saying by both verbal verbal acknowledgements like ums and ooms or trying to summarize what

information next we have the different formats the formal coaching which is
coaching sessions you set up on uh set Cadence weekly or bi-weekly uh with people this requires

their coach uh then we have impromptu coaching which is the on the-fly coaching the
most useful for everybody working individual contributor role like a coder or a designer or something like that and
then finally you have a team coaching which can be both formal or impromptu but when we address a whole team this
might be interesting if you're trying to do like an organizational change or trying to work through team problems

us into the coaching conversation then we have excavation we dig deep and try

questions we try to bring it down to one actual thing that we're going to work on
we create a few options for that thing thing by looking around what's already been tried what hasn't been tried what
has worked in the past what should we try next and then we pop an action question to make sure that something
actually happens after the conversation if we follow this when people come with problems
decisions uh and that type of stuff to us we can actually have them
leave with the things instead of leaving the things with us so this makes them
grow because now they have accountability they become better at what they do but it also unburdens us
